The KOSPI and KOSDAQ also dropped sharply due to new lows on a daily basis. Samsung Electronics, the leader of the KOSPI, also wrote a new 52-week low. The won also fell to its lowest level in the market this year. The domestic financial market is shaken by the fear of 'R (Recession)'. This is because central banks in major countries such as the United States have accelerated austerity measures and fears of an economic slowdown have increased. As of 11 am on the 20th, the KOSPI is trading at 2384.12, down 2.33% from the previous trading day. During the day, the KOSPI fell to 2301.46, breaking the previous 52-week low (2384.49). At the same time, the KOSDAQ is also trading at 773.77, down 3.12% from the previous trading day. It was foreigners' 'sell bomb' that brought the stock price down. Currently, foreigners have net sold 435.2 billion won worth of the KOSPI market. The 'lion' of individuals (333.1 billion won) and institutions (87.8 billion won) is also insufficient to defend the stock price. As of 11:15 a.m. on the same day, eight of the top 10 stocks by market capitalization were falling. LG Energy Solutions (-2.94%), SK Hynix (-2.70%), Samsung Biologics (-2.16%), Naver (-2.74%), and KAKAO (-3.88%) are also plunging 2-3% in price. . In particular, Samsung Electronics is trading at 58,400 won, down 2.34% from the previous trading day. At one point during the day, the share price fell to 58,100 won, recording a 52-week low. While Samsung Electronics' stock price plunged 24% this year, foreigners sold 8.9 trillion won worth of goods, leading the decline. As a result, the foreign ownership of Samsung Electronics fell to 49.97%. It is the first time in six years that this number has fallen below 50%. According to the Korea Exchange, foreigners net sold 68.34 trillion won in the KOSPI and KOSDAQ markets for two years and five months from 2020 to the 17th. By year, it net sold 24.72 trillion won in 2020 and 25.95 trillion won last year, and this year it sold 17.68 trillion won by the 17th. Foreigners' participation in 'Cell Korea' is interpreted as the effect of increased risk-avoidance sentiment due to concerns about an economic downturn. The Wall Street Journal (WSJ) released a survey on the 19th (local time) that there is a 44% chance that the U.S. will fall into a recession within the next 12 months. This is higher than the probability of a recession (38%) predicted by economists in December 2007, when the global financial crisis occurred. The fear of a recession has been triggered by intense austerity by the US Federal Reserve. The Fed is poised to risk a recession to catch inflation (inflation). "Inflation is likely to continue and we support a 0.75 percentage point hike in July," said Neil Kashkari, president of the Federal Bank of Minneapolis, who is classified as dovish (monetary easing). Seo Jeong-hoon, an analyst at Samsung Securities, said, “Even after the US Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) raised the interest rate by 0.75 percentage points in June, the comments of Fed members are still hawkish. A rebound in the stock market will not be easy for the time being.” The won's value is plummeting due to the strong dollar and strong foreign selling. On the 20th, in the Seoul foreign exchange market, the won started trading at 1291 won per dollar, down 3.7 won from the previous trading day. Within 15 minutes of trading, the won slid to 1293.6 won per dollar, rewriting the new low recorded on the 15th (1293.2 won intraday).

Dealers are working at Hana Bank's Dealing Room in Jung-gu, Seoul on the 20th, when the KOSPI started to rise slightly, but is falling again due to the selling trend of foreign investors. On this day, the KOSPI rose 8.96 points (0.37%) from the previous trading day to 2449.89, the KOSDAQ index rose 5.79 points (0.72%) to 804.48 from the previous trading day, and the won-dollar exchange rate in the Seoul foreign exchange market rose 3.7 won to 1291.0 won from the previous trading day. was opened The KOSPI fell more than 2% during the day and again fell below the 2400 line. Foreigners are net selling in the spot and futures markets, adding downward pressure. As of 11:20 am on the 20th, the KOSPI was at 2391.56, down 49.37 points (2.02%) from the previous trading day. During the day, it fell to 2381.20, the lowest level since November 5, 2020 (2370.85). Foreign selling is expanding the decline in the index. At this time, foreigners are selling 446.5 billion won in the stock market, and KOSPI 200 futures are net selling 544.5 billion won. The won-dollar exchange rate reached its highest level in 13 years, reaching 1295 won, stimulating foreign selling. On the other hand, individuals are buying 345.3 billion won in the stock market and net buying 257.7 billion won in KOSPI 200 futures. In the case of institutions, they are net buying KOSPI W106.1bn and KOSPI 200 Futures W266.4bn. As a result, there is a strong downward trend centering on stocks with high market capitalization, which are held by foreigners. Samsung Electronics is trading at 58,200 won, down 1,600 won (2.68%) from the previous trading day. At one point during the day, it fell to 58,100 won, breaking a new 52-week low. Others LG Energy Solutions (-3.06%), SK Hynix (-3.01%), Samsung Biologics (-2.40%), LG Chem (-1.04%), NAVER (-2.95%), KAKAO (-4.16%), Kia (-0.79%) and others are also falling all at once. Lee Kyung-min, head of investment strategy at Daishin Securities, said, "Fear of a recession is a bit excessive. "It's a step ahead of the situation, and I think it's highly likely that we will enter a calming phase for the time being."

Autonomy rather than platform regulation… Ministry of Science and Technology’s Telecommunication Act Son Bo-on (cited by Maeil Economic Daily) Regulatory Department Instead of the Fair Trade Commission and the Korea Communications Commission, the Ministry of Science and Technology, a promotion agency, created an organization to promote self-regulation of the scoring platform in earnest and established guidelines. The Ministry of Science, Technology and Information and Communication was selected as the competent ministry. The fact that the Ministry of Science and ICT, a platform promotion agency, is in charge of related work, rather than the regulatory agencies such as the Fair Trade Commission or the Korea Communications Commission, is an analysis that suggests that there will be no excessive regulation on platforms in the Yoon Seok-yeol administration. According to the relevant ministries on the 20th, the 'online platform self-regulation' plan included in the national task is expected to be included in the telecommunication business law under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Science and ICT. A high-ranking government official explained, "The name of the Telecommunications Business Act has been changed to the Digital Service Act, and the plan for self-regulation of the platform has been almost completely coordinated." During the Moon Jae-in administration, a new law was enacted to prevent platform operators from beating their stores. On the other hand, the Yoon Seok-yeol government decided to implement 'self-regulation' on the belief that regulation through the bill could weaken the overall business competitiveness of the platform industry. The main goal of the platform self-regulation plan is to create a self-regulatory body jointly invested by private operators, and to prepare industry autonomous guidelines with contents such as strengthening transaction relationship transparency, enhancing user convenience, and enhancing data accessibility. A representative role model is the self-review of medical advertisements, which has been conducted since 2018 by three groups of medical professionals (the Korean Medical Association, the Korean Dental Association, and the Korean Oriental Medical Association). In addition, the FTC plans to expand a system similar to the CP (Compliance Program) to the platform business field to promote autonomous deliberation. If you receive a CP grade of A or higher, you can be exempt from the Fair Trade Commission investigation for up to two years. The purpose is to give incentives to platform operators who do not abuse the stores and comply with self-regulation. As for platform regulations, the sales of retailers vary by tens of thousands depending on how much products are exposed on the main screens of platform operators such as Naver and KAKAO. It was discussed as concerns were raised that it could 'drive work'. The 'On-Platform Fairness Act (On-Plat Act)' promoted by the Fair Trade Commission in the past is a representative regulatory bill. The On-play Act prohibits unfair discrimination against shopkeepers by manipulating and changing search and arrangement rankings, and contains the content to establish a standard contract to prevent abuse in advance. The problem is that the written contract between the platform and the vendors specified in the Onplay Act is mandatory. The FTC did not, but the platform industry objected, saying, "In fact, it is to disclose an algorithm that is a trade secret." When the self-regulation of platforms was specified as a national task under the Yoon Seok-yeol administration, the On-play Act of the Fair Trade Commission and the User Protection Act of the Korea Communications Commission, which was being prepared with a similar purpose, were pushed down to the next priority. In addition, there is an analysis that the platform self-regulation plan is under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Science and ICT (revision of the Telecommunications Business Act), and the focus is on 'promotion' rather than 'regulation'.

KAKAO enters overseas expansion through content followed by commerce 2022.06.21. Edited at 5:38 PM 2022.06.21. 7:32 pm Reporter Dae-seok Oh KAKAO's subsidiary KAKAO Style Zig-Zag targeting the US and Japan in July. Domestic fashion and beauty brand products can be purchased directly from overseas consumers, exporting webtoons, web novels, and videos. This time, it will also advance into overseas markets in earnest in the e-commerce (commerce) field. Through the fashion platform 'ZigZag', which it acquired last year, it has decided to enter the commerce market in the US, Canada, and Japan from July. It is a 'Yeok-Jikgu' commerce platform business that helps locals buy Korean fashion and beauty-related brand products. It is noteworthy whether KAKAO, which took this year as the first year of its global expansion, can continue its success with K-fashion and K-beauty following K-content such as webtoons, web novels, and videos. According to the distribution industry on the 21st, KAKAO Style, a subsidiary of KAKAO, delivered a store proposal for the 'ZigZag Global' application (app) to be introduced in July to a number of domestic brands. ZigZag is a fashion/beauty-focused commerce platform operated by KAKAO Style. In Korea, it achieved 35 million cumulative downloads, 3.7 million monthly users, and 1 trillion won in annual transactions as of last year. ZigZag Global will be released as a separate app from ZigZag in Korea. Domestic fashion and beauty brands can sell their products to customers in any country they want by entering ZigZag Global. In particular, ZigZag Global supports global customer service (CS), logistics system, and localized marketing, which are barriers to overseas sales. It opens an export channel for selling Korean fashion and beauty products to the world by allowing anyone to easily open a market without the need to establish a local corporation. After entering the US, Canada, and Japan markets in July, KAKAO Style plans to continuously expand the countries that ZigZag Global has entered. A KAKAO Style official said, "ZigZag Global will start trial operation from July." "We launched the fashion e-commerce app 'Now Now' in Japan in 2019. direction,” he said. KAKAO Style has mentioned the global expansion and reverse direct purchase business several times this year, but this time, the specific time and countries have been confirmed. It is known that the company has been continuously preparing for global business by recruiting related personnel and strengthening logistics capabilities. The first target was the United States and Japan because those countries occupy the second and third largest e-commerce scale after China, and the K-beauty and K-fashion craze is blowing with the success of K-content over the past few years. In the case of large fashion brand companies, there are more and more cases of successful entry into the market on their own in line with this trend, but small and medium-sized brands and shopping malls are still having difficulties entering the overseas market. KAKAO sees commerce as a new growth engine and a key resource for overseas expansion, and is concentrating on its business. Until now, KAKAO's global expansion has been mainly led by K-contents such as webtoons, web novels, music, and videos. It was necessary to diversify because it focused only on content. In particular, it is easy for fashion to create synergy with the entertainment business that leads K-content export within the group, thereby increasing its global influence.

KOSPI's 6th annual bottom - KOSDAQ also hits new lows As the outlook for a decline in semiconductor demand in the second half of the year hit the domestic stock market, the KOSPI and KOSDAQ indexes both hit new lows. Analysts say that the downward pressure has increased as foreign investors' sell-off and counter-trading volumes have been pouring in. Although the domestic stock market has entered a state of less than book value, it is predicted that investors will withdraw from the market for the time being due to concerns about an economic downturn. ○KOSPI index 6th annual low in this month On the 22nd, the KOSPI index closed at 2342.81, down 2.74%. It broke the new low (2372.35) recorded on the 20th. This is the sixth time the KOSPI has reached a new low this month. The KOSDAQ index also plunged 4.03% to close at 746.96. The KOSDAQ index also hit a new low (763.22) on the 20th. What pulled the stock market down was foreign selling. Foreigners net sold 381.9 billion won in the KOSPI and KOSDAQ combined. Samsung Electronics (55.5 billion won) and SK Hynix (45.8 billion won) ranked first and second in the stocks that foreigners sold the most on the Korean stock market that day. Institutions also put a burden on the stock market by selling 143.9 billion won worth of in both markets. Individuals net bought about 501.1 billion won and received the amount. The strong won-dollar exchange rate also had a negative impact on foreign supply and demand. On that day, the won-dollar exchange rate finished trading 1297 won 30 ago. The depreciation of the yuan also contributed to the strengthening of the dollar. “The US stock market rose the previous day, but the domestic stock market fell today,” said Kim Hak-gyun, head of Shinyoung Securities’ research center. Analysts analyzed that the negative outlook for the semiconductor industry in the second half of the year pulled down the stock price. On the previous day, global investment bank (IB) Morgan Stanley lowered the target price of US semiconductor company Micron Technology by $27 to $56. It is analyzed that DRAM and semiconductor prices will fall faster than expected due to sluggish PC and Chinese smartphone demand in the third quarter. Like Korea, Taiwan, where the semiconductor industry is the main industry, was also a bear market. Taiwan's Chachuan Index closed at 15,347.75, down 2.42% on the day. As negative outlooks for the semiconductor industry have emerged one after another, the Korean and Taiwanese stock markets are undergoing a greater correction than other countries this year. The KOSPI index fell 21.61% this year, and the Jachuan index fell 16%. During the same period, the Nikkei 225 Index and the Shanghai Composite Index fell only 10.76% and 10.05%, respectively. As the stock market has recently plunged one after another, the volume of counter-trading of 'debt investment' has increased, which is also considered to be the cause of the weakness in the domestic stock market. According to Shinhan Investment Corp., the amount of credit loans with a loss of more than 20% is estimated at about 7.8 trillion won. This is 38.9% of the total amount of credit loans (about KRW 20.30 trillion). Choi Yoo-jun, a researcher at Shinhan Investment Corp., said, "The reason why the domestic stock market has been sluggish compared to the global market in the recent downturn is because the pressure for counter-trading has increased. There is also a diagnosis that the domestic stock market has entered an 'oversold phase'. This is because the price-to-earnings ratio (PBR), which refers to the book value of the stock market, has fallen to 0.95x, the lower end of the long-term range (0.9-1.1x). Dae-Jun Kim, a researcher at Korea Investment & Securities, said, “Fear of the domestic economic outlook has overtaken the fundamentals.

surge in counter-trading is fueling a downturn. Individual investors' 'debt investment' (investment made with debt) is fueling the decline in the stock market. As the number of counter-trading by individual investors (compulsory liquidation of stocks received by securities companies as collateral from investors) has rapidly increased during the recent slump, an analysis suggests that the burden of selling due to deterioration in supply and demand is increasing downward pressure on the stock market. According to the Financial Investment Association on the 23rd, the average daily counter trading volume recently exceeded 25 billion won, showing a high level. On the 15th, about 31.555 billion won of stocks were sold in one day alone, the highest since the beginning of the year. This is almost double the daily average counter sales of last year (16.34 billion won). The proportion of counter-trading to consignment receivables also stood at 13.1%, a double-digit figure. One of the factors that has caused the KOSPI to drop sharply compared to the US Nasdaq and Asian stock markets in recent years is counter-trading. In a situation where the stock market is showing a lot of volatility, it is analyzed that a vicious cycle is appearing in which the stock price falls further as those for sale that have not been able to pay back money or sell stocks in advance come to the market as counter-trading. The receivable transaction consists of a structure in which an investor borrows money from a securities company to buy stocks and repay the money. In this case, the opposite sale price is often set as the lower limit, which has a significant effect on the stock price. Kang Song-cheol, a researcher at Eugene Investment & Securities, said, "It is estimated that a vicious cycle will occur in case of a decline as the number of counter-trading increases as the stock price declines. It is the highest level since the peak of 10.1% at the time of the financial crisis in October.” It is explained that the increase in stock purchases through credit during the course of the stock price surge in 2020-2021, when the Donghak ant craze blew after the novel coronavirus infection (COVID-19), is acting as a burden in the process of falling stock prices. Researcher Kang said, "The balance of credit loans has surged after the stock price plunged at the time of Corona 19, and is still at a high level compared to pre-COVID-19, both in absolute terms and relative to the market capitalization. “It is burdensome that if the decline continues, it could be a factor that increases the decline,” he explained. As of the 21st, the credit balance recorded a total of 1.854.6 billion won, including 1,067.9 billion won in the KOSPI and 9,246.7 billion won in the KOSDAQ. Choi Yoo-jun, a researcher at Shinhan Investment Corp., said, "The reason the domestic stock market has been sluggish compared to the global stock market in the recent downturn can be found in the lack of incentives to buy at the bottom, and the pressure to sell, including counter-trading, has increased." It is estimated that the amount of investment that individual investors would have made with a credit loan and would have suffered a loss of 20% or more compared to the current index would amount to about KRW 8 trillion (KRW 4.5 trillion in KOSPI, KRW 3.3 trillion in KOSDAQ). “It is possible that the inflows have been repaid before, but it is clear that the amount of inflows near the peak of the index is significant,” said Choi. There is a possibility that the stock will face a downward trend that exceeds the extent of fundamental damage due to selling pressure,” he explained. / You can't tell the difference between billions and trillions!! As of the 21st of last month, the credit balance recorded a total of 19.8 trillion won, including 1,067.9 billion won in the KOSPI and 9,246.7 billion won in the KOSDAQ. ********* It is estimated that about 8 trillion won (a huge amount of less than half) out of a total of 19.8 trillion won was estimated to have suffered a loss of 20% or more compared to the current index when individual investors invested with credit loans. is the amount

Are you saying it's incompetent to stop short selling? Do you study stocks? Even in the United States, where a repayment period was compulsory for short selling, after the Lehman incident, there was a war with short selling due to the Game Stop and Robin Hood cases. It was a battle between institutions and institutions. Although the government failed to intervene because it infringed on the autonomy of the market, it was concluded that the short-seller forces were defeated by introducing a cap on short positions, and the stock market began to normalize. Moreover, the country is not a key currency country like the United States, and the market itself is undervalued. Short selling has no choice but to become a means of securing cash assets for outsiders, not to contain the bubble. For example, when the real economy in India improves, it is a method of recovering the profits from short selling in the Korean market and purchasing Indian capital (the same is the recent trend). It was banned, and the stock price at the time was soaring and successful. At least back then, there was a workaround. But what about now? There is no solution... Which one is really the big one?

The won-dollar exchange rate finally surpassed 1,300 won The won-dollar exchange rate was trading at 1300.3 won, up 3.0 won from the previous trading day (1297.3 won) as of 9:09 am in the Seoul foreign exchange market on the 23rd. On that day, the exchange rate opened at 1299.0 won, up 1.7 won from the previous trading day. From the start of the market, the ointment point (1297.9 won) recorded the previous day was renewed again in one day, and then it rose to 1300.4 won during the market. It is the first time in 12 years and 11 months since the exchange rate broke the 1,300 won mark during the day since July 14, 2009 (1303.0 won based on the high). The won-dollar exchange rate in the offshore difference settlement futures (NDF) market last night rose to 1,304 won at one point during the day, exceeding 1,300 won first. The dollar depreciated slightly. On the 22nd (local time), the dollar index (DXY), which measures the value of the dollar against the currencies of six major countries, fell 0.22% to 103.980. Investors paid attention to the remarks of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell. Chairman Powell said at the Senate Banking Committee meeting on the 22nd (local time) that "inflation will remain on course until we see evidence that it is falling," reaffirming the existing position that continued rate hikes are necessary to quell inflationary pressures. "There is definitely a recession," he said. "It has become significantly more difficult to achieve a soft landing. At the FOMC held on the 14th and 15th of the last month, the US Federal Reserve took the 'giant step' to raise the key interest rate by 0.75 percentage points. Market participants believe the Fed is likely to carry out a 'giant step' next month as well. Major New York stock indexes closed lower on fears of a recession. On the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) on the 22nd (local time), the Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 34,83.13, down 47.12 points (0.15%) from the previous day. The Standard & Poor's (S&P) 500 index fell 4.9 points (0.13%) to 3759.89 from the battlefield, and the Nasdaq index, which focuses on tech stocks, also closed at 11,053.08, down 16.22 points (0.15%) from the battlefield. On the same day, in the New York bond market, the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield fell 3.91% to 3.151%. The two-year bond yield, which is sensitive to monetary policy, fell by 4.46% from the previous field to 3.051%. Min Kyung-won, a researcher at Woori Bank, said, "The exchange rate today exceeded 1,300 won due to the influx of demand for remittance and repositioning of risky assets, which was triggered by concerns about an economic recession despite the weak global dollar." “Acknowledging that there is, funds moved overnight to traditional safe-haven assets such as bonds and the yen,” he said.

Breaking News (Seoul = News 1) Reporter Hyung-ki Park = Product investment genius Jim Rogers warned that "the worst downtrend of our lives is approaching." The S&P 500 is down 21% this year. But "this is just the beginning," Rogers notes. He said, "The largest amount of money has been released since the beginning of the crisis due to the corona pandemic," he said. “We will experience the worst descent of our lives,” he added. He said this in an interview with 'ET Now', an economic channel, on the 22nd (local time). He said there is no safe haven in capital markets. In an era of inflation, he pointed out that gold, silver and food are still relatively safe investments. Gold and silver are typical inflation hedges. He especially recommended investing in silver. Silver is widely used in the production of solar panels and is in increasing demand as it is an important component in the electrical control unit of a vehicle. He also saw food as attractive. It is because they have to live on food even in the age of inflation, and the price of food is rising due to the war in Ukraine. He recommended the Invesco DB Agricultural Fund (DBA). DBA is a fund that tracks an index consisting of futures contracts for the most widely traded agricultural products, including corn, soybeans and sugar. The fund is up 9% this year. He is so legendary in the investment world that he co-founded the Quantum Fund with George Soros in 1973. Since then, he has mainly invested in commodities and is also called the genius of commodity investment. He points out that North Korea is an attractive market and shows a lot of interest in investing in the Korean Peninsula, including frequent visits to South Korea.

After Yoon Do-ri took office, nothing happens in the stock market~ ㅠㅠ The KOSPI fell 13.83% this month alone, the biggest monthly drop since October 2008. The KOSDAQ fell 20.03% this month, the biggest drop since October 2018. Although the global stock market has entered a bear market as a whole due to austerity measures and concerns about an economic slowdown, the recent decline in the Korean stock market has been particularly noticeable, causing individual investors to suffer. On that day, individuals poured out a total of 736.5 billion won, selling 672.2 billion won in the KOSPI market and 64.2 billion won in the KOSDAQ market. A significant amount of this amount is estimated to be the counter sale of credit loans that bought stocks with debt. The reason why the KOSDAQ stock market, which has a high proportion of individual investors, has plunged is also because the stocks of individuals who invested in debt were forcibly liquidated and fell into a vicious cycle of decline. The outstanding credit balance, which is the amount that has not been repaid after an individual invests in stocks through credit transactions, has fallen to the lowest level (19,530.8 billion won) in one year and five months, increasing the selling pressure across the stock market. This is why there are forecasts that the KOSPI 2300 and KOSDAQ 700 levels are imminent. When the stock price plummeted due to the corona virus, President Moon initially banned short selling for a year, but Yoon Moo-sik, who had to stabilize the country at the beginning of his inauguration, was focused only on seizing power and political retaliation such as the incorporation of the police into the Ministry of Public Administration and Security. Investors are demanding measures such as a ban on short selling and a stock market stabilization fund in the face of a financial crisis, as they did not even give a message, let alone measures. Also, when the reporter asked Do-ri Yoon, 'Do you have any measures for the price increase?', he shook his head and said, "Well, is there any other way around the world? When short selling was abolished, the daily average of short selling exceeded 500 billion won in a downtrend... Institutional stocks 'concentrated saturation' LG Ensol short selling worth 23.3 billion won per day "Indices fall further when short selling surges" The 'short selling risk' in the stock market is a sign of expanding. With more than 500 billion won in short selling transactions per day, institutional properties that had supported the downturn in the index have emerged as the main target for short selling. As foreigners still account for most of the short selling, individual dissatisfaction is on the rise. According to the Korea Exchange on the 24th, the average daily short selling transaction value in June was 502.9 billion won. Compared to last month (477.8 billion won), the size increased by 5.25%. There are more short selling transactions worth 25.1 billion won every day. As of the 20th, the KOSPI short selling balance stood at 11.7657 trillion won, down 522.2 billion won compared to the end of last month. The main target of short selling is observed to be stocks accumulated by institutions in a down market such as LG Energy Solution, Samsung SDI, and KAKAO Bank. LG Energy Solution averaged 23.3 billion won in short selling in the previous 40 trading days, and Samsung SDI and KAKAO Bank averaged 10.5 billion won and 9.7 billion won, respectively, in the same period. It is predicted that volatility could further increase if institutions net bought nearly 900 billion won of the KOSPI this month and even their stocks spill out. This is because the burden of supply and demand on individuals, the last safety pin of the stock market, is expected to increase. Kim Young-hwan, a researcher at NH Investment & Securities, said, "The fact that the purchasing power of individual investors, who were the main buyers of the stock market from 2021 to 2022, is decreasing, means that the downward rigidity of the Korean stock market may weaken." It is necessary to keep in mind the possibility of large volatility due to the Short selling in the domestic stock market is led by foreigners. On the 22nd, the proportion of individuals based on the short selling transaction amount was 1.83% of the total, while the proportion of foreigners was 81.50%. Individual dissatisfaction with short selling is also reaching its peak as the index slides without a brake in a situation where the 'slanted playground' is still there. Voices calling for a temporary ban on short selling are pouring in from the investor community. Chung Eui-jung, president of the Korea Equity Investors Association, said, "Foreign investors are selling domestic stocks every day, and short selling, which is pouring oil on a fire, is increasing the decline. It should be,” he said. Individual investors are also arguing that, for equity, the repayment period of short selling for foreigners and institutions should be limited to 90 days, the same as that of individuals, and the collateral ratio should be raised to the same 150% level as the United States without differentiating each investment entity. Experts also suggest that it is necessary to consider implementing policies such as a temporary ban on short selling at this point. It is analyzed that the six-month ban on short selling, which was implemented at the beginning of the spread of COVID-19 in 2020, played a role in the rebound of the KOSPI. Lee Kyung-soo, a researcher at Hana Financial Investment, said, "In a situation where the supply and demand base is insufficient at a time of increasing index volatility, a surge in short selling may cause an additional decline in the index. You can figure it out,” he said. However, the industry view is that it is unlikely that the government will consider a temporary ban on short selling in a situation where the government is putting effort into improving the short selling system. The government announced the new government's economic policy direction on the 16th and did not mention short selling.

After all, it rises when it rises The KOSPI and KOSDAQ index are rebounding on the 24th due to the inflow of low-priced buying led by institutions. At 9:57 am on the same day, the KOSPI was at 2349.28, up 34.96 points (1.51%) from the previous day. The index opened at 2327.11, 12.79 points (0.55%) higher than the previous day, increasing the extent of its rise. At the same time, the KOSDAQ index recorded 737.32, up 22.94 points (3.21%) from the previous field. After starting at 719.47, up 5.09 points (0.71%) from the previous day, it has soared. The KOSPI, which broke a new low for two days in a row due to foreign selling and individual speculative trading, appears to be trying to recover from a sharp decline thanks to the strength of the US stock market. In the stock market, institutions net bought 163.9 billion won, leading the index's rise. Individuals and foreigners net sold 157.6 billion won and 7.3 billion won, respectively. In the top market by market cap, Samsung Electronics (2.61%), SK Hynix (1.44%), NAVER (3.85%), and KAKAO (5.66%) rose sharply, leading the index rebound. In the New York Stock Exchange last night, the Dow Jones Industrial Average (0.64%), the S&P 500 Index (0.95%), and the Nasdaq Composite (1.62%) all rose. This is the result of an influx of low-priced purchases mainly in technology stocks, which have been burdened with valuations due to the rise in interest rates as the US Treasury yield fell sharply. Reflecting concerns about an economic slowdown and declining international oil prices, the previous day, the 10-year US Treasury yield fell 7.3bp (1bp = 0.01 percentage point) to 3.088% per annum. The two-year bond also fell 2.0bp to 3.027% per annum. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said earlier in the Senate that he would continue to raise interest rates until he finds evidence of a fall in inflation. However, after that, the House of Representatives took a step back from the possibility of a recession, saying that the economic growth in the second half of the year will be quite strong. The won-dollar exchange rate, which broke 1,300 won for the first time in about 13 years the day before, opened at 1300.0 won, down 1.8 won on the day. Seo Sang-young, a researcher at Mirae Asset Securities, said, "The fact that the US stock market rose after confirming Chairman Powell's confidence in the economy is positive for the domestic stock market." Naver and KAKAO's stock price is unpredictable. "Even if it is a long-term investment, there is no guarantee that it will go up to a high. It has fallen so badly that it can't even 'water up' (buying a low when the stock price falls and lowering the average purchase price) and is letting go. ." According to the Korea Exchange on the 24th, KAKAO closed the day at a 2.04% drop and Naver closed at a 2.18% increase the day before. The day was divided, but if you extend the period to about half a year, both stocks are drawing a steep downward trending graph. The stock prices of KAKAO and Naver have fallen by 40.36% and 38.18%, respectively, this year alone. Considering that the KOSPI fell by 22% during this period, the decline in these big tech stocks is particularly large. Exchange-traded funds (ETFs), which contain more than half of KAKAO and Naver, are also at the bottom of the list. During the period, 'TIGER KRX Internet K-New Deal' and 'TIGER Software' lost 50.47% and 40.71%. This is the era of growth stocks. As external variables such as economic slowdown, inflation (inflation), and interest rate hikes have given shocks one after another, the valuations (valuations) of representative growth stocks are steadily declining. Growing concerns over economically sensitive advertising and commerce businesses are also cited as a factor in the downtrend. There were also 6 reports of lowering the target price (4 KAKAO and 2 Naver) this month alone. It is known that some asset management companies had envisioned ETFs containing popular growth stocks such as Naver and KAKAO last year, but soon abandoned their plans. This is because the stock market has fluctuated from the second half of last year to this year, and companies in the Internet industry, such as platforms and games, fell sharply. In the wake of the big tech crash, the ants started investing in a 'buy and see' style. As the stock price has fallen a lot, it is a strategy to buy water or buy at a low price. Looking at the top stocks by investors from the beginning of the year to this day, individuals bought Naver and KAKAO the most after Samsung Electronics. The net purchase amount was KRW 2.109.2 trillion from Naver and KRW 1.801.4 trillion from KAKAO. On the other hand, in terms of institutions and foreigners, the situation is reversed. It is one of the most neglected sports. During the same period, foreigners sold 1.53 trillion won and 1.23 trillion won worth of Naver and KAKAO, respectively. Foreign net sellers ranked 3rd and 5th respectively. Institutions also net sold Naver 664.5 billion won and KAKAO 599.2 billion won. In the midst of this, the beliefs of individual investors who support big tech stock prices are gradually shaky. The main reason is that you never know when the plunge will end. Investors who were bitten by high prices flocked to the discussion rooms of various stocks of the two companies. They said, 'There are people on the 38th floor of the Naver platform. There is still a long way to go even though I have been constantly on the water', 'I don't have money to water anymore, and it's too big for me to stop losing. Opinions such as 'I have no choice but to hold on', 'Naver knows everything else but why won't they tell me when it will rebound', 'I will never see KAKAO even on the day of my escape', 'I thought it would fall further, so I lost 30% and stopped losing' raised Even experts in the stock market can't easily predict the timing of the rebound. According to these analyzes, the P/E ratio of KAKAO and Naver is still considerably higher than that of overseas Internet companies. This also means that if the high growth rate of the two major business divisions breaks down, the multiple could drop sharply to the global level. Microsoft and Alphabet, the global big tech giants, have plummeted by more than 24% in the past six months. Hee-seok Lim, a researcher at Mirae Asset Securities, said, "Global Internet companies that have been rallied in their stock prices for the past 10 years, having been recognized for their growth stock status, have been turning into value stocks since the second half of last year. On the other hand, Korean companies are still at the crossroads between growth stocks and value stocks. Until the growth rate is reconfirmed, it is expected that the share price of domestic big tech companies will be sideways for a long time.” Kim Gwang-hyeon, a researcher at Yuanta Securities, said, "No one can predict the timing of the rebound. However, if it is confirmed that the won-dollar exchange rate has reached its peak in the future, foreign funds will begin to flow from supply and demand. “It is necessary to think about it,” he said. 71,000 won, up 3900 won

am the stock emperor who sheds tears, Dana is the stock emperor who sheds tears. The autobiography of Young-doo Yoo, chairman of Boram Securities Plaza, who became the main character in paying billions of dollars in stock capital gains tax from bad credit. This autobiography is not just for show off to others or for boasting or display to leave a mark on oneself. Until he became the main character of paying 3 billion won in stock capital gains tax, he is delivering the wisdom, blessings and hopes he shared with his acquaintances from the heavens where he truly received help to those who are in dire need. Although this book depicts the success story of a man named 'Young-doo Yoo', the background of his success is clearly different. The stifling struggle between individuals in the stock market and the reality of the global financial structure, which must have been passed through to become a 'stock emperor' that everyone has dreamed of at least once, appears as the main stage. As the title suggests, he overcame all kinds of hardships and adversity by shed two tears to achieve success. The process of struggle to survive in the stock market, where stocks that gave dreams and wealth become pieces of paper overnight, and the history of a wrinkled life with ecstasy, give readers in their 20s and 30s a seed of hope, and they lose their dreams all of a sudden. It is a guidebook sufficient to awaken readers in their 40s and 50s who are weary of Table of Contents First Tears Taste a priceless setback -I am not a stockbroker -Unfortune and good fortune are like old lovers -Counseling with God-Yoo Young-doo and Elliot's fateful meeting Second tears Gorgeous life, rushing to the climax -The return of the king, returning to the stock market -Becoming a myth of a paid investment lecture -Trial that comes again -When there is no place to retreat, the person who becomes stronger is the third tear In the chaos, he takes center stage -Half of my life, a stockman -The myth of billions in stock capital gains tax -Tax-paying super king ant -Secret of Success -Things I want to tell beginners -Third tears that I haven't shed yet Epilogue-Life is like a stock I literally went to the bottom in a folding book I became a bad credit person due to the IMF, and I had nowhere to go, so I slept at Seoul Station I slept and tried to catch my stomach. There were times when a loan shark came with a knife, and I also went to the Han River to die. The shape of the Milky Way was overlapped by Elliott's ladder wave. I wondered if I had seen it wrong, so I jumped up from my seat, rubbed my eyes, and looked again, and it still seemed to slowly approach me in that shape. As if to deliver some kind of revelation... As I expected, on November 7, 2007, the price of Samsung Electronics and Hyundai Heavy Industries became almost the same at around 550,000 won. Now, I finally saw the ghost's reality with my own two eyes. Real ghosts exist! And in 2008, gambling investors became stockbrokers due to the subprime mortgage crisis and were dumped on the street. Not long ago, while paying billions of won in taxes, I made another resolution. I will make the day I pay tens of billions of dollars in taxes. Hundreds of billions of won is a higher figure than most small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). I will make a day to pay this amount of tax.

President Young-doo Yoo, why did he write an autobiography? President Young-doo Yoo, why did he write an autobiography? This autobiography is not just for show off to others or for boasting or display to leave a mark on oneself. Starting with the pure purpose of improving the quality of life by sharing the wisdom, blessings, and hope shared with many acquaintances from the sky where he truly received help until he became the main character of paying 3 billion won in stock transfer tax became What is the main character trying to say in the book? Although this book depicts the success story of a man named 'Young-doo Yoo', the background of his success is clearly different. The stifling struggle between individuals in the stock market and the reality of the global financial structure, which must have been passed through to become a 'stock emperor' that everyone has dreamed of at least once, appears as the main stage. As the title suggests, he overcame all kinds of hardships and adversity by shed two tears to achieve success. The process of struggle to survive in the stock market, where stocks that gave dreams and wealth become pieces of paper overnight, and the history of a wrinkled life with ecstasy, give readers in their 20s and 30s a seed of hope, and they lose their dreams all of a sudden. It is a guidebook sufficient to awaken readers in their 40s and 50s who are weary of The main character, Yoo Young-doo, what kind of person is he? As an autobiography, this book also has numerous episodes. His courage in the process of three disastrous failures is truly astonishing. He believed in his abilities and tried to contact his acquaintances rather than sitting down in a homeless life where he could not solve a meal, and he eventually woke up. Rather, it completes a successful drama that produces greater profits. On the other hand, he is a stockman who rides the super-high-speed elevator of success with betting power and courage unimaginable by ordinary people, but he is also a heart-warming man who relieves stress with a guitar and a few songs and sees an impressive opera dozens of times. 'One more self-congratulations, I met a really nice person.' These are the words of Chairman Yoo Young-doo in the book. Yes. He has a lot of really nice people around him. For example, when he was homeless, he implicitly bought him a bowl of warm rice, believed in his ability and willingly handed money to him, saying he would help him. If you want to pay back that you didn't help yourself, if someone in need like you appears, ask that person to help and send him back. Also, he went down to a prayer center run by his friend to stay, and although it was a small amount of money, he had to stay for a while. Rather than waiting for a good person, I must first become a nobleman. His acquaintances who helped him like this do not help him to achieve greater profit if he succeeds, knowing in advance that he will succeed, but because they genuinely love and trust him. Here, the reader realizes that I can be the attribution next to those who succeed. He also said that if you have only one friend who can truly grieve when you die, that life is a success. Much less, Chairman Yoo Young-doo can be said to be a successful person just by looking at a few acquaintances in this book. As mentioned earlier, his personality is optimistic. With such an optimistic accident, he got up like a dwarf who got up no matter how many times he fell. His unremitting efforts are indispensable when it comes to his rise. It may be considered good fortune to find the right circumstances for him, but such a lucky opportunity only comes to those who work hard. The stock theory from the perspective of Yoo Young-doo He earnestly asks readers to accept the Elliott Wave Theory in their own way and use it in their own way. It is an intangible tool and value that brought him success, but it can be poison for those who do not know the bitter cup of failure and only profit from investment. Moreover, he warns that jumping into the stock market without preparation is dangerous. As his life tells us, investing in stocks is a game you can't win. There are no winners and no losers. Therefore, the most important thing to be wary of before investing in stocks is to dream of success without being able to grasp the reality of capital hidden behind capital like a ghost and interpret other people's theories in your own way like Elliott's theory. Into the book... His autobiography is difficult to pin down. If I had to choose, he did not disclose the know-how that appeals to the eyes and ears, although many people will want to know his own know-how about stocks - which stocks to buy to make money - because it is an autobiography of Chairman Yoo Young-doo, a stock expert. . As with most people up to now, I think this is to raise the alarm for the fluke psychology of readers who want to become the main character of their life with unearned income or stocks. Chairman Yoo Young-doo, as he mentioned in the book's prologue, investing in stocks is not a speculation, but a philosophy and the crystallization of life meditation. However, readers who frequently read books may be reluctant to approach them because their outspoken tone is unfamiliar. His dream journey to shed the third and last tears Nevertheless, after reading this book, it becomes cruel. I want to see the tears in the eyes of Chairman Yoo Young-doo once more. But it's not easy to see. This is because all five of his remaining dreams must come true. I hope the readers will see with their own eyes what that dream is.

From Larry Summers' scary warning mockery to craze... Summers' 'Early Recession Theory' that shakes the US E-Daily 2022-06-26 13:27:45 Harvard University Professor Larry Summers, along with City University of New York Professor Paul Krugman and Columbia University Professor Jeffrey Sachs, are the 'three superstars' of American economics. is called He is a genius who became the youngest tenure professor at Harvard University at the age of 28. In particular, he is a 'Democrat' who served as Treasury Secretary in the Clinton administration and as chairman of the National Economic Council (NEC) of the White House in the Obama administration. In the Democratic camp, he has been treated as the best economic elder. For him, the past 1 year and 6 months have been more upsetting than ever. In February of last year, the Washington Post (WP) wrote that “inflation that has not been experienced in a generation will come” was the beginning. In January and February of last year, the US Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased by 1.4% and 1.7% compared to the same month of the previous year. It was still cheap. Nevertheless, Summers has been at the forefront of price warnings, openly criticizing the Biden administration's loose money. In the process, he even had to hear 'stupid' and 'politician' ridicule from Democrats like Krugman. ◇The economics superstar who was ridiculed as a 'stupid' "In the end, Summers was right." These days, it is the most talked about word on Wall Street and in academia in the United States. The speculation reached its peak when it became known that President Joe Biden spoke with Summers aside from Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and Fed Chairman Jerome Powell. President Biden's approval rating is at its worst ahead of the November midterm elections. In a hurry, he sought advice from Summers, who had been critical of him for a year and a half. A Wall Street bond adviser said, "Now I have no choice but to watch Summers' comments." So, what is the core of the diagnosis and outlook that Summers is proposing? According to the paper ‘Comparing Past and Present Inflation’ published by Summers this month, the CPI growth peak of 14.8% during the 2nd oil shock from April 1978 to July 1983 was restored in line with modern consumption patterns. As a result of calculation, it was found to be 11.4%. In the case of the first oil shock from June 1972 to December 1976, the highest was 12.3%, and if it is modernized, it becomes 9.1%. This is the result of recalculating housing prices that were not properly reflected in the past CPI. The most recent CPI increase of 8.5% last month is not much different from the worst oil shock in the past. "Inflation right now is much closer to a historic high than the officially published figures," Summers said. “Summers is right” His second heavy warning is that Summers pays attention to the relationship between low unemployment and inflation. The U.S. unemployment rate for May was 3.6%. full employment level. However, Summers thinks that this is an optical illusion created by many people who do not work even though they are old enough to work, that is, have left the labor market altogether. In fact, the labor market participation rate (labor force/the economically active population aged 16 and over) in May was 62.3%, lower than February 2020 (63.4%), just before the pandemic. The long-term average of the job opening rate and the retirement rate from 2001 to 2019 is estimated to be 3.1% and 1.9%, respectively. However, now they are 7.0% and 2.9%, respectively. Demand from companies to find people has skyrocketed, meaning that many employees are leaving in pursuit of higher salaries. In a recent 'The Conversation' column, Summers argued that "wage growth today is accelerating at a historic pace at 6.6%" and that "wages are the ultimate measure of inflation." "In these circumstances, there is no basis for optimism that inflation could be lowered to the Fed's 2% target," he said. His diagnosis eventually leads to the conclusion that “recession is inevitable.” It is said that unprecedented inflation can be suppressed only when the unemployment rate rises because companies cannot withstand high wages and hire people. “We need an unemployment rate of 7.5% in the next two years, 6% in five years, and 10% in one year,” Summers said. There is no basis for a 'soft landing' of lowering inflation to the Fed's target of 2% without a recession. Summers appeared on Bloomberg TV again on the 24th (local time) and warned of an early recession, saying, "There is a 75-80% chance of a recession in the next two years. A portfolio manager at a Wall Street financial company said, “Summers’ analysis that the unemployment rate just before the successful soft landing in 1984 was over 10% is impressive,” said a portfolio manager at a Wall Street financial company. Summers' early recession is shaking the US more convincingly than last year's high inflation warning. https://m.newspic.kr/view.html?nid=2022062613274522970&pn=179&rssOption=RECOM&recommend_market=false

The future of KAKAO Games [This week's artificial intelligence] Even after the launch of 'Uma Musume', the stock price fluctuates and falls, and the new lineup is expected in the second half of the year, but the listing of the subsidiary is a 'bad news' Last week (June 20-24) The KOSPI index fell the previous week (2440.93) It closed at 2366.60, down 74.33 points (3.05%). In one week, individuals net sold 1.43 trillion won, foreigners 1.29 trillion won, and institutions net bought 2.65 trillion won. Last week's topic was KAKAO Games. The new game, Uma Musume: Pretty Derby, released on the 20th, is getting a good response from users, but the stock price is going sideways. The stock price, which plummeted on the first day of its release, rebounded the next day when Uma Musume rose to the top of the Apple App Store's popularity rankings and sales. After that, it fell for 22-23 days in a row due to the sluggish Google Play Store sales ranking, but it ended up rising again on the 24th on the news that it was ranked 5th in Google's sales ranking. On the KOSDAQ market on the 24th, KAKAO Games finished trading at 49,400 won, up 5.78% (2,700 won) from the previous day. It is hovering around the lowest level in a year and a month since May of last year. The market expects Uma Musume to deliver good long-term results. If Uma Musume maintains its top 3~4 position in domestic sales, KAKAO Games will be able to secure more than 120 billion won in additional sales per quarter. It is expected to diversify sales by reducing dependence on Odin, which accounted for 60-70% of existing sales. Hee-seok Lim, a researcher at Mirae Asset Securities, predicted, “‘Uma Musume’ will be successful in the early stage by dispelling concerns about the non-mainstream subculture genre. Even with the launch of a new game, the outlook for KAKAO Games is mixed. Expectations for a new lineup in the second half are still valid, but one-off expenses such as increased marketing for 'Uma Musume' may cause earnings to slow down. In particular, as the possibility of an initial public offering (IPO) of Odin developer and subsidiary Lion Heart Studios has been raised, concerns are growing about the parent company discount, which will damage the corporate value of KAKAO Games. Hyundai Motor Securities lowered the target price of KAKAO Games by 10% to 90,000 won. On the other hand, there is a forecast that the stock price will rebound thanks to the launch of large-scale new products in the second half of this year. Donghwan Oh, a researcher at Samsung Securities, said, “After ‘Odin: Valhalla Rising’, which was released in Taiwan, Uma Musume is expected to continue to increase profits until the second half of the year. ??I am a stock emperor who sheds tears ??I am a stock emperor who sheds tears An autobiography of Young-doo Yoo, chairman of Boram Securities Plaza, who became the main character in paying billions of dollars in stock capital gains tax from bad credit. This autobiography is not just for show off to others or for boasting or display to leave a mark on oneself. Until he became the main character of paying 3 billion won in stock capital gains tax, he is delivering the wisdom, blessings and hopes he shared with his acquaintances from the heavens where he truly received help to those who are in dire need. Although this book depicts the success story of a man named 'Young-doo Yoo', the background of his success is clearly different. The stifling struggle between individuals in the stock market and the reality of the global financial structure, which must have been passed through to become a 'stock emperor' that everyone has dreamed of at least once, appears as the main stage. As the title suggests, he overcame all kinds of hardships and adversity by shed two tears to achieve success. The process of struggle to survive in the stock market, where stocks that gave dreams and wealth become pieces of paper overnight, and the history of a wrinkled life with ecstasy, give readers in their 20s and 30s a seed of hope, and they lose their dreams all of a sudden. It is a guidebook sufficient to awaken readers in their 40s and 50s who are weary of Table of Contents First Tears Taste a priceless setback -I am not a stockbroker -Unfortune and good fortune are like old lovers -Counseling with God-Yoo Young-doo and Elliot's fateful meeting Second tears Gorgeous life, rushing to the climax -The return of the king, returning to the stock market -Becoming a myth of a paid investment lecture -Trial that comes again -When there is no place to retreat, the person who becomes stronger is the third tear In the chaos, he takes center stage -Half of my life, a stockman -The myth of billions in stock capital gains tax -Tax-paying super king ant -Secret of Success -Things I want to tell beginners -Third tears that I haven't shed yet Epilogue-Life is like a stock I literally went to the bottom in a folding book I became a bad credit person due to the IMF, and I had nowhere to go, so I slept at Seoul Station I slept and tried to catch my stomach. There were times when a loan shark came with a knife, and I also went to the Han River to die. The shape of the Milky Way was overlapped by Elliott's ladder wave. I wondered if I had seen it wrong, so I jumped up from my seat, rubbed my eyes, and looked again, and it still seemed to slowly approach me in that shape. As if to deliver some kind of revelation... As I expected, on November 7, 2007, the price of Samsung Electronics and Hyundai Heavy Industries became almost the same at around 550,000 won. Now, I finally saw the ghost's reality with my own two eyes. Real ghosts exist! And in 2008, gambling investors became stockbrokers due to the subprime mortgage crisis and were dumped on the street. Not long ago, while paying billions of won in taxes, I made another resolution. I will make the day I pay tens of billions of dollars in taxes. Among the 40 global indexes this month, the KOSDAQ and KOSPI KOSPI indexes, which ranked 1st and 2nd in drop rates, recorded a 12% decline this month, returning to the level at the time of the COVID-19 pandemic. It was pointed out that there is Rising exchange rates and oil prices are also considered to be factors that put pressure on the stock market, but the burden of credit transaction loan balances is limiting the overall stock market rebound due to supply and demand issues. Credit transaction loan balance refers to the balance of loans secured by stocks or cash, which is a kind of speculative demand. This is because, while leveraged funds through credit transactions contribute to liquidity supply in a bull market, they trigger counter-trading in a bear market, adding to the downside risk of the market, such as a larger decline in the stock price of stocks with high credit balances. According to the Korea Exchange on the 28th, from June 1 to 24, the KOSDAQ (-16.02%) and the KOSPI (-11.89%) ranked first in the decline rate among 40 representative indices of the global stock market. This is in contrast to the 3 to 5% declines in New York's three largest stock markets during the same period. Compared to other emerging countries similar to Korea, such as Brazil (-11.39%) and Argentina (-10.49%), the results are sluggish. As for the reason the Korean stock market was particularly sluggish, the securities industry cited the size of 'debt investment'. It is the size of the credit loan balance that can be seen, and the credit transaction loan balance of the KOSPI market was found to be 0.6% of the market cap and 2.7% for the KOSDAQ. Compared to the pre-COVID-19 average (KOSPI 0.4%, KOSDAQ 2.3%), it is still high. Observing the historical pattern, in order for the stock market to recover to the pre-COVID-19 level, the credit and loan balance must be cleared up by 3 to 5 trillion won in the future. point out that it needs to be done. Heo Jae-wan, a researcher at Eugene Investment & Securities, said, "Most of the share price drop last week came from counter trading due to a lack of margin. The problem is that, in the case of the domestic stock market, the total trading value of the stock market is decreasing due to a sharp drop in stock prices, while the credit balance ratio is showing a stepwise decline. This means that the credit loan balance is not decreasing as quickly as the decrease in the market cap. Ji-young Han, a researcher at Kiwoom Securities, said, "The burden of credit transaction loan balances is limiting the overall stock market rebound. In particular, as the stock market has fallen this year, leveraged funds have flowed back in the background. ), some of them were reinvested into the stock market, and the surge in credit for related theme stocks after the March presidential election seems to have had an impact,” he analyzed. “In order to alleviate the credit burden, additional stock market adjustments must be made to reduce the credit loan balance, or the stock market must rise as macro-environmental uncertainties ease and the market capitalization must increase, but both are difficult to meet in a short period of time,” a researcher said. did.

The Financial Supervisory Service Director Lee Bok-hyeon, the head of the Financial Supervisory Service, set up an investigation team dedicated to short selling, and said, "Price decisions or trends in the market are difficult to influence and cannot influence," said Lee Bok-hyeon, head of the Financial Supervisory Service, as to the counter-trading of securities companies, which has been cited as a factor in the recent decline in the stock market. Regarding market stabilization measures such as the ban on short selling, he said, "There is a point where we can find a point of contact." Lee Bok-hyeon, head of the Financial Supervisory Service, met with reporters after the 'CEO meeting' on the 28th and said this. He said, "I have doubts about whether there is a way to do it because counter-trading is a systemic thing." Counter-trading means that a securities company forcibly disposes of stocks that an investor bought on credit decline and fail to maintain the collateral ratio. Although the recent decline in the stock market has led to a number of accounts that failed to fill the collateral ratio, it is pointed out that this is encouraging the stock market to go down again, but Lee emphasized the principle of not intervening in the market. He also conveyed to the industry that the FSS would directly take action on factors that promote the downturn of the stock market, such as illegal short selling. At the meeting, they also announced that they would establish a team dedicated to investigating short selling and strengthen the inspection and investigation of illegal short selling. He said, "We will take swift, serious and swift action against any act that causes damage to investors taking advantage of market instability, such as establishing a short selling investigation team and strengthening the inspection and investigation of illegal short selling." Regarding the temporary ban on short selling, which was implemented two years ago at the time of Corona 19, he said, "The direction of market stabilization measures and measures to secure efficiency may differ in some cases, but I think there are parts where a point of contact can be found." The focus of the meeting was on risk management as the domestic and foreign economic and financial conditions worsened and market volatility increased, such as the sharp decline in the stock market this month. President Lee emphasized in his remarks on the same day, "It is necessary to closely monitor potential risk factors so as not to undermine the stability of the capital market and prepare thoroughly." Specifically, Δ liquidity management due to short-term financial market crunch, Δ project financing (PF) against securitized securities risks such as loans and Δ stress tests for each market shock scenario, etc. were discussed. The CEO of an asset management company said, "As this is the first meeting since taking office, it was a meeting to discuss major issues such as risk management." Investor protection following the expansion of individual investors' participation in the stock market was also mentioned as a major topic. President Lee requested, "Please thoroughly check whether there is any possibility of conflict of interest or potential damage to investors when dealing with major shareholders or affiliates or circumventing transactions using SPC." He further emphasized, "It is necessary to be alert and self-correct about unreasonable pursuits of private interests, such as excessive profit-seeking behaviors and bicycling of insolvent assets." Regarding the direction of supervision of financial investment companies, he emphasized the precautionary inspection. It means reducing inspections and investigations that were inevitably carried out in the system and concentrating core competencies on necessary cases. He said, "We will preemptively block unfair transactions using undisclosed information or the company's or investors' property for personal gain by insiders, such as the company's management or major shareholders, through a preventive inspection. We will prevent a second private equity fund incident by strengthening the private equity market monitoring system by integrating and managing fund-related data,” he said. At the meeting on this day, 10 securities companies (Mirae Asset, Korea Investment, Samsung Securities, KB Securities, Meritz Securities, Kiwoom Securities, Shinyoung Securities, eBest Investment & Securities, SK Securities, JP Morgan) and 6 management companies (Shinhan, Hanwha, Woori, Daol) · Marston, DS, Eastspring) attended.
